name: The beekeeper's house
pages:
Research Notes No. 36

Today I found a dilapidated house in the flowered forest.

It's already bizarre enough for someone to decide to settle away from civilization, but NOT a Predator? It seems like a miracle

that he even managed to build the structure without being assaulted by the undead, considering that there is no trace of the remains of a Golem protecting him.

The owner, now conquered by the Plague, was so engrossed in his work that

he didn't even notice me, probably in life he was so dedicated to his little creatures that it remained ingrained even in this state. Who knows for how many years he has been working uninterruptedly to take care of his bees, seeing him like this almost evokes pity.

From his diary, I presume that he secluded himself away from everyone precisely because of the disease, but somehow he was infected anyway. I have to keep this in mind for my next research.

He also seemed particularly devoted to the absent deity. I
wonder how desperate he must have been to still believe that something like that could save him.
